column1: caught behind first ball! Comes out braving the cold, goes back for an early coffee. #SmallMercies. Australia, meanwhile, are elated. Stanlake pitches it up outside off, has Zhuwao chasing after it. Normally, that would have screamed through the cover point boundary. But in this case - because of the lack of footwork - he just nicks through
back of a length and outside off, leaves it. Hint of awayswing in the air for Stanlake
struck on the body as Masakadza looks to flick a shortish delivery angled into him
draws him into a lazy old drive and that away swing - that very late away swing - takes it past the outside edge. Stanlake's looking mean today. #WhatElseIsNew?
looks for the blockhole now and Masakadza brings down a straight bat to save himself
good length ball on middle, defends stoutly
knocks it down gently straight of midwicket for a single. That's more like it. Mire playing close to the body, covering the line of a ball angled into middle
pokes outside the off stump as Richardson hits a fuller length. Masakadza is stuck in the crease but his hands lunge out to meet the ball. Soft hands though, which is good

dropped by the debutant! Jack Wildermuth tries to get under the skier at third man as Masakadza slogs wildly. The back of a length ball leaps off the top edge and starts to dip as it nears the fielder. Wildermuth has committed to take it reverse cup and even ends up diving forward in a desperate attempt to pull it off. In the end, it pops out. Really should have taken it the normal way
fuller delivery on middle, he turns it into the leg side
hangs back and flicks a shortish delivery through midwicket
angles a short of a good length delivery in at off stump, Masakadza plays late, chopping it to point for a quick single
goes short and Masakadza hoicks it through midwicket. Powerful strike. Standing tall, telling the bowler who's boss

another one that he digs into the pitch, this one coming up towards Masakadza's chest. The batsman pulls, gets struck on the glove, and as the ball wanders to square leg, he slinks through for a single

rippper! It beats Mire's outside edge and goes hunting for the off stump. Prey escapes predator by the smallest margin as the ball bounces just over it. Sensational stuff from Stanlake. Hitting the deck on middle and getting late away movement
full on middle, Mire blocks to cover
bang! Straight over the top! Mire's got quality. And he shows it by picking Stanlake's fuller length, striding confidently forward and smacking him over mid-on. An outstanding shot!
shortish and outside off, he dabs it to third man. Sensible batting. Controlled batting.
extra bounce as Richardson bends his back and goes short. Mire goes for the pull on instinct and mistimes it to deep midwicket
scoops a fast bowler capable of hitting 140 kph all the way to the long leg boundary! Superb stuff from Masakadza, always has his eyes on the ball, and connects splendidly

chops on! A short and wide delivery that deserves to be cut through cover point ends up pinging off the inside edge onto the stumps. Seems like Masakadza is fooled by a throttling down in pace. A wicket each in the Powerplay for Australia's quicks. That's job well done
too short, and it even leaps over the wicketkeeper Carey to run away for four
zips through past the top edge as Musakanda goes for a cut shot
stays back and slices a shortish delivery to point
sees width, goes after it, comes away swishing at thin air
shortish and outside off, glides it down to third man
taps the back of a length delivery into the covers for a quick single
targets the top of off but Mire gets in between the ball and the bulls-eye
a hint of width and that's enough for Mire to exploit; lovely late cut, along the ground to third man
a slower ball, but he hits the deck with it. Musakanda reads it all perfectly, pulls his bottom hand off, nudges it to the left of the pitch and pinches a single
opens the face and finds a boundary. Very smart by Mire. He's in form. He's picking the ball well. And it is the change-bowler, so he definitely has to go after him
stays put in front of a shortish delivery and absorbs all of its threats with soft hands
short and wide and Musakanda latches onto it with a vengeance. Cut with all of his power to the point boundary
keeps going short and wide - but this time he makes sure it travels higher. Musakanda looks for the upper cut, but can't catch up with it
that's insane! He presses forward, not caring that Stanlake releases that little white thing at near 150 kph - and quite effortlessly lifts it over mid-on

appeal for a catch! It's Wildermuth down at thie third man boundary, running forward and diving low to pick up a fine catch. The umpires check for a no-ball and that's all they check for before sending Musakanda on his way. The dismissal is rather similar to the catch that Wildermuth dropped earlier in the game. A wild slap looking for the boundary (at cover perhaps) resulting in an edge flying to third man. This time the debutant makes a better effort
they're going up again, but umpire Tiffin is unmoved. End of a top over from Stanlake, as he beats the bat of the set batsman with an outswinger at outrageous pace
tosses it up on off stump, drives to cover
nudges it through midwicket
goes back to a flatter delivery on off stump and pats it to extra cover
opens the face to find a single through to the sweeper
looms over the flighted delivery in leg stump and deflects it to the left of short fine leg
hangs back to a shortish delivery and turns it through the vacant midwicket region
full on middle, pushes it back at the bowler
stands tall against a back of a length delivery outside off and punches it through to deep point
slower ball that deceives Mire. He's set up to launch it over the leg side, thinking it's length and it's in the slot. But the lack of pace makes him think twice and in the end leave it outside off
another slowy - perhaps the knuckle ball too, considering it moves in the air and squares Mire up. Outside edge down to point
takes the pace off again, but Moor is looking for it, adjusts his bat swing appropriately and flicks a straight one to long leg
spots the variation, hanging back until it finally arrives in his half of the pitch. Little late cut thereafter sends it down to third man
clears the front leg and laces an overpitched delivery right at his partner at the other end. Single as the ball deflects over to long-on
tosses it up on middle and leg, Moor defends

leading edge... swirling away past the shoulder of Tye, running back from cover.... lands safely. Superb bowling from Agar, even if it doesn't result in a wicket. Lobbing the ball up over the batsman's eyeline and getting it to dip and turn so that a hit straight down the ground becomes a panic-stricken wait for Moor to see if he's still alive in the game
clears the front leg again as Agar targets leg stump and hits the length ball down to long-on
flatter and fuller on off stump, Moor drills it back to the left-arm spinner
good length ball outside off stump, the batsman pushes it through cover point
gets up off his toes so that he can hit the short ball on top of its bounce and send it scampering away to the left of both point and the sweeper cover. Good technique
pitches it up, angling the ball into the right-hander. Mire skews it off the inside edge to deep square leg
bouncer, which keeps coming in at the batsmen. Moor drops his wrists and avoids contact
defends a shortish delivery to the right of point
pulls a rising delivery from outside off to long-on. Not enough room, and perhaps more pertinently, too much bounce for him to properly time the ball
opens the face to guide a good length ball to third man
flirts with a back of a length delivery outside off and is comfortably beaten. Tiny bit more bounce than Moor is ready for
he's forced back into his crease by a short ball, coming up towards his chest. Moor does well in the end, to use soft hands and blunt it by his feet
gets forward to drill a fuller delivery to mid-off
goes for a bouncer outside off, but it may just have wandered too high for its own good

direct hit would have knocked Mire out! Maxwell is the man at point, cutting the angle very well as he runs to his left to grab the ball and take a shy at the strikers' end. Decent shot from Moor, but not the best judgment of a run
slogs a back of a length delivery to long-on
sharp pace again as he goes full and outside off. Mire camps on leg stump, not really keen on getting in line with the delivery and so ends up comfortably beaten
short ball now, only a shade outside off stump. The lack of room, and that it comes near his shoulder, makes Mire decide not to dabble with it
swishes outside off - this one giving him a little more width to free the arms - but Stanlake's got too much heat on the ball
rocks back to slap the short delivery outside off to point
yorker on off stump, Moor digs it out
back of a length and outside off, slaps it to point
works his wrists over a shortish delivery on middle and finds a couple between long-on and midwicket
backs away, prompting Tye to follow the batsman and go as short as he can. But with this pitch already offering plenty of bounce, the ball soars over Mire's head as he leaves

launches it in the air, and it lands safely, just beyond the reach of a diving Maxwell! Superb work, in travelling so fast to catch up with the outside edge, and even while doing so, tracking the ball over his shoulder. Big dive to make something happen, but it falls just in front of his outstetched hand
good length ball on middle, which is turned through midwicket. Mire plays with soft hands looking for two and he gets it
slogs a length ball outside off to deep square leg

knuckle ball utterly deceives Mire, and for a second time, it only just misses his stumps. Stanlake had a chance at knocking out his off stump earlier in the day. Now Tye comes within inches of messing the middle one up. A slog with no luck or skill attached to it
clatters a short ball outside off away over deep midwicket. Good work in getting on top of the bounce to connect as cleanly as he did
another superb shot, this one along the ground, it's USP the placement. It skips past point on his left, and then bisects the sweeper and deep third man
and there's the little bit of luck a batsman needs. Stoinis goes to top pace as he tries to bounce Moor. He goes for the pull and gets a top edge over the keeper
slower ball on middle, Moor taps it to point. That's the fifty partnership
scoops a length ball on middle stump over the short fine leg fielder. That's 19 off the over already
knuckle ball, bobbles out to become a yorker too. Mire keeps it out
top-edges the slog and three men are haring up after it, from deep midwicket, long-on and even the bowler looking to make something of it. Lands right between them
slings it through from a low arm, and at a much higher pace, as Mire swings and misses
another very quick delivery on middle, Mire nudges it to cover for a single
tries a slog sweep, but mistimes it so badly the wicketkeeper gets to it
reverse sweep now, and it s a superb shot, simply because Agar is bowling quick and at off stump, with third man and point up. Mire spots the flaw in Australia's plans and exploits it superbly
makes room and lashes a short ball over deep midwicket, into the grass banks. Brutal hit from Mire and Zimbabwe have finally got their groove on. Thirty-two runs off the last two overs.
spots Moor making room and so slows his pace down and plants the ball wide outside off. Clever bowling earns a dot
he's worried that Moor would be making room again and goes too wide outside off. Penalised
back of a length and outside off, Moor looks for a late cut but is beaten

carves it over the top - and he really has timed the pants off it - the only problem is it sails straight to deep point. Moor takes on the long boundary and comes up short. He had to hit out though, with only four-ish overs left
back of a length and outside off, slashes and misses
full and outside off, slices it to deep point
full on off stump, he nudges it towards mid-on
shortish on off stump - no pace on it though - as Chigumbura knocks it down towards where short midwicket would have been
stands tall and pulls a slower short ball out to deep midwicket to bring up his second fifty in successive games
cramps him for room with a top-pace delivery on off stump. Chigumbura mistimes a late cut to point
top edge, taken by square leg running in! It's a short ball, not really affording him the room to swing his arms. Also comes onto him too quickly, leading to a mis-hit.
full and outside off, Mire slogs away, but gets a leading edge over short third man. Knuckle ball deceives the batsman, but he still profits
massive! This time he nails the back of a length delivery off the middle of the bat and it sails over the backward square leg boundary. Mire's on fire. (Had to be said)
good length ball on off stump, blocks behind point
wide yorker - perfectly executed. Even Mire can't make something out of it.
runs outside off to try to try and scoop the ball - but the perils of premeditation is that he has missed out on a full toss, which he could have hammered over the off side
backs away and hammers a short ball over extra cover. What a shot! The timing on it! The sound of it leaving the bat!
full toss outside off, smears it to the left of the sweeper cover. Two balls faced, two super shots for boundaries. Malcolm Waller is just what Zimbabwe needed right now
adjusts to the back of the hand slower ball and lashes it away to the sweeper. Twenty-five runs off the last two overs; 52 off the last five.
drills a near yorker on leg stump out to extra cover
looks for another yorker on middle, Mire gets it off the inside edge to short fine leg

taken by deep square leg! Good work from Tye, and it's his go-to delivery too. Change of pace, which is perfect against a batsman wanting to slog everything. Waller goes for a pull, mistimes it and ends up being caught, and quite easily at that
full and outside off, slaps it to extra cover

he risks a second in an effort to retain strike, but Tiiripano is not quick enough, nor does he dive. Mire hits to long-off. It should have only been a single but Zimbabwe need the established batsman on strike. They'll get that, but Tiripano's gone

full and straight. Mire goes across the line for a slog over wide long-on - he kinda has no choice but to play shots line that - and makes no contact. That means the ball has a clear path to uproot off stump. Fifty wickets in T20s in 2018 for Tye
full toss outside off, Mavuta smashes it to the point boundary
back of a length and outside off, blocks to point
shortish and on off stump, pulls through wide mid-on
slower delivery, well wide outside off, Masakadza skews it to deep point
full and outside off, slaps it to mid-off

walks across outside off, trying to smash the ball over the top, perhaps a lot straighter than mid-off. But that's where it goes and Marcus Stoinis, running back, takes it over his shoulder. Fine effort to give the debutant a first ODI wicket
full and drifting into the pads, Finch tries to dab it fine, but he can't make contact with the bat.
stays around the wicket to the left-hander too, and Carey pulls the flatter delivery outside off to deep midwicket
backs away outside leg, but Masakadza follows him with a quicker delivery. Finch flicks through midwicket
keeps pushing it through in line with the stumps, Carey blocks

gets down low to scoop the ball right over the keeper's head. Premeditated shot, which is how Masakadza is able to adjust and bowl as quick as he can. Carey overbalances as he makes contact, but it's still good enough
nudges it through midwicket
shortish and at the hip, Carey turns it behind square leg
flicks another back of a length delivery from off stump away to deep square leg
opens the face to steer a short delivery outside off to point
unsettles the left-hander by targeting the body - Muzarabani is well over six-feet tall, so its no surprise that he's getting awkward bounce. Single off a flick behind square leg
tries to glance the ball, sliding down leg, to the boundary but he can't touch it
tries to pull a short and wide delivery - perhaps off pace as well - and gets an inside edge to deep square leg
lifts a good length ball straight down the ground - but this has gone high. Mid-off and mid-on are racing after it, but the ball lands just in front of them both

taken at deep midwicket! It's a long hop from a spinner and it's absolutely smacked away. Problem is it zeroes in on Musakanda on the boundary. The in-form Finch is back in the hut and the chase is only two overs old. How will Australia respond?
shortish on off stump, defends
shapes to pull, but he doesn't read the pace of the ball off the pitch properly and mistimes the shot so badly that it doesn't even go too far off the pitch
turns a fuller delivery on leg stump through midwicket
run-out chance as the left-hander digs out a yorker and the non-striker thinks there's a single at cover. Carey sends Head back and a dive saves the Australian
goes for the slog sweep and gets struck on the back leg. But Masakadza's delivery pitches outside leg so the lbw appeal won't stand
full delivery outside off, Carey smacks it through extra cover. Pace on the ball making a difference in favour of Austrlaia
short on middle, he pulls to deep square leg
stands up tall behind a back of a length delivery on off stump and defends to point
drifts down the leg side and Head doesn't make contact with the flick
rises with the bouncer on middle and off stump and blunts it by his feet
opens the face and slices the shortish delivery to point
slower ball on leg stump, Head works it to deep square leg
short and outside off, Carey glides it behind point, but the fielder does well, putting in a dive
blocks a shortish delivery down the pitch and sets off looking for a single. Realises it's not there just in time

caught behind! Superb work from Muzarabani. He spent his couple of overs targeting Carey's body. Now he sends one angled across the left-hander. Carey flirts with it, looking for a single to third man, and only ends up nicking through. Pace, plenty of bounce and early success for the tall right-arm quick
strays down the pads, Maxwell misses out on the flick
tucks a good length ball outside off through square leg

stays put in his crease to defend another rising delivery from Muzarabani. His lines to the left-handers has been very very good so far. Head gets an inside edge on this occasion and Maxwell scampers through for a single
full and outside off, he drives to point
full and outside of, Head lashes it to point
drives in solid fashion to cover. Tiripano hitting good areas on and around off stump
walks down the pitch - showing he's under pressure over the lack of runs. Tiripano bangs it in short, and it wanders past Head's shirt, and right over leg stump
gets under the short ball to lift it over the keeper and away to the third man boundary. Upper cut, well executed
walks out and across his stumps again to flick through to mid-on
prepares a flick shot, but the ball not coming onto the bat puts him off. It eventually ends up deflecting off the pads to short fine leg
full on off stump, Maxwell pushes it to mid-off and pinches a single
short and wide, but since it's slow as well it beats Head's cut shot
full and outside off, Head drives sweetly through the covers
nicks it past the keeper! Taking the pace off is working big time on this pitch. It's offering extra bounce as well and both of those combine to mess with Head's cut shot
another slower ball, which Head deflects away to deep third man
short and on leg stump, he pulls to long leg
leading edge first up as he tosses it up on leg stump and Head is lunging for the ball, meeting it too early
pushes it through down leg. Head looks for a flick, no luck there. but he does get a wide and then rushes for a single as the keeper fumbles the take
flights it on off stump, Maxwell plays for turn, but the drift into the right-hander secures an inside edge
drives through the covers for a couple. Australia almost solely concentrating on singles and twos to recover lost ground
short and wide, Maxwell cuts to deep point
googly from the debutant, which Head dabs away to deep third man
misreads the googly this time. It's tossed up, drifting away from the left-hander, turning as well. Head is only gingerly playing at it and gets an edge that goes nowhere
shapes to pick a short ball off middle stump over square leg. But he's into the shot too early and ends up hitting it off a leading edge to point

struck on the helmet Head is into a pull shot and goes through with it too soon. The ball strikes him on the side of his head. He doesn't seem to be in any sort of trouble though. Sends Maxwell, who is looking for a single, back and then later the physio too.
pulls a short ball away behind square leg
flicks a shortish delivery to long leg
slower ball outside off, Head drives to mid-off for a single
dipping slower ball on middle, Maxwell presents the full face for a single to long-on
flicks a short one from middle and off stump to deep midwicket
short ball, which Head pulls past Masakadza's left. The throw from the deep hits the stumps direct at the striker's end and ricochets for an overthrow

shifts his weight back against the shortish delivery and flicks it behind square leg. Smart footwork from Head, who wants a second. He needs to hurry. The throw from Muzarabani is right next to the stumps... Replays have it very very tight... and Head may well have been in by a frame. Those zing bails might have helped there.
works a good length ball off the back foot towards square leg
shovels it all the way over the extra cover boundary! Maxwell is reaching out - it would have been a wide had he missed it - but Maxwell still manages to hit it with monstrous power
pushes it through on off stump, Maxwell is waiting for the change in length as he calmly flicks through midwicket
skids through past the pads of Maxwell even as he tries to flick it away. Deflection off the pad puts the keeper off from collecting it
smashes it over long-on! Simply done by Maxwell as he meets a half volley with the full face and ensures it has enough of his strength to take it all the way
rank delivery - short and down leg - Maxwell pulls it away to the left of long leg. Muzarabani saves a boundary
quicker delivery outside off, Maxwell pushes it to long-off
on the pads, Head nudges it to deep midwicket
flatter delivery on middle, Maxwell clears his front leg and punches to midwicket
googly on middle, Head hangs back and turns it to square leg.
shapes to slog a legbreak over long-on but hitting against the turn - especially when the ball is way outside off - is rarely helpful. Maxwell is beaten
googly on off stump, Maxwell swings it around to short fine leg
long hope which Head monsters away to the midwicket boundary.
comes down the track and though the bowler tries to stump him by sneaking the ball down leg, Head is able to flick it away to deep square leg
quicker delivery on middle, Maxwell goes back to block and gets an outside edge through point
defends a full delivery on off stump towards point. Another straightforward single
shimmies down the pitch and lifts the length ball on leg stump away to deep midwicket
backs away and smears a full delivery on leg stump over to the extra cover boundary. Brutal strike, one that showcases his bottom-hand strength
shortish on middle, Maxwell taps it to the empty spaces at mid-on and midwicket to take a couple
good length on off stump, defends
full on middle, Maxwell turns it to long-on
shortish and outside off, Head slaps it past the left of point
length ball, asking to be hit and Maxwell doesn't disappoint. Presses forward and launches it over midwicket.
short now, and Maxwell pulls it away to the left of deep midwicket
gets the late cut going but he can't beat short third man
gets down the track and yorks himself. Only an inside edge saves him from being bowled
short and outside off, Maxwell cuts to the sweeper
loops the googly up so very wide outside off. Maxwell thinks about it, but settles for the wide
pulls a short ball away to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, Head cuts it behind point
shapes to slog a tossed up delivery on leg stump, but it spins the wrong way, so he has to chop the ball into the off side for a single.
cuts the flatter delivery to point
googly on off stump, Maxwell defends, reading the variation just about well enough
makes room outside leg to open up the covers, but because he goes hard at the ball, he mistimes it back at the bowler
dropped but it is a seriously difficult chance because Head rushes down the pitch and gets an outside edge while trying to loft over the covers. Could have had him stumped too.

length ball - offering Maxwell room to free the arms too - and he takes full toll of it. Winds up and launches the bad ball over long-on to bring up his half-century. Points at both of his eyes in celebration, while the umpires bring out a new ball.
good length on middle stump, defends
short and wide, Maxwell pummels it straight down the ground. Another powerful hit for six
spears a quick delivery in at leg stump, Maxwell inside edges it
inside edges a short ball and it wanders out to long leg. Muzarabani's bounce is still so very unsettling
drives straight to short cover! With Australia almost to the finish line, their top-scorer hits a length ball off the bottom of the bat straight to Chigumbura
gets his shuffle on to work a back of a length delivery on off stump away to deep midwicket
slower ball on leg stump, Head taps it towards square leg
good length on middle, Maddinson defends
rises with the short ball and steers it quite nicely to deep third man
goes for a pull seeing the length short, but it's also a slower ball and that deceives Maddinson as he is hit on the body. Still, Australia get a leg bye with Head calling him through for a single
full and outside off, drills it to mid-off

caught at square leg! Two wickets in two overs - are Zimbabwe still in this? Maddinson goes for a pull shot but the ball is at him a llittle quicker than he'd like. Miscues it for Muzarabani to come into play as he dives forward to take the chance
offcutter, which Head nudges through square leg
full on off stump, he tucks it to the right of long-on, with soft hands, to ensure he can get a couple of runs before the deep fielders get a look in
pulls a slower short ball out to deep midwicket
works a good length ball on leg stump out to deep square leg

caught at long-on!  Australia are goofing off with a win in sight! The set batsman - Head, who has been ever so careful to avoid any risk in his game today - goes for a big shot with the run-rate just barely over 6. And he finds Masakadza waiting to pounce on his mistake
good length ball outside off gets Stoinis forward with a defensive push. It results in an outside edge that wanders away to deep third man

goes straight up! Long-on is right on the edge of the boundary. Masakdaza, alancing himself as well as he could, takes the catch reverse cup. But he is starting to overbalance, so he flicks the ball back into the field of play. So close for Zimbabwe... So close...
full and outside off, Agar drives to cover. Stoinis at the other end is looking for a single, which is why Waller takes a shy at the stumps and gives away two overthrows
back of a length and outside off, steers it to deep point
starts with a short ball that goes way wide outside leg
slower ball outside off, Agar flashes and misses as it spins away from him. Harsh call from the umpire to label that a wide though. Doubt it was.
good length and it's the offcutter again. Agar pokes and misses
low full toss which Agar inside edges onto pad. Stoinis, the better batsman of the two, races away to steal the strike.
slower short ball, which Stoinis pulls for a single to deep square leg
smacks it to mid-off and just sets off. Masakadza fumbles as well, allowing Australia's desperation move to succeed, despite his recovery and subsequent direct hit
low full toss, which Stoinis smashes over square leg and it's Australia's game
